page.title: 01A GENERAL GAZETTEER
page.content: Our block is in the Chilterns.It is predominately undulating farmland,with approximately 1/5 privately owned woods.It includes most of Old Amersham Coleshill and Winchmore Hill,and all of Penn Street. As it is only about 30 miles from London some people commute from New Amersham and Beaconsfield. There has been an influx of many people from outside the area,but a large number have lived here for generations. Few houses have been built within the last 30 years. There is a great variety of styles,with many typically Bucks:brick and flint houses. It is well-served by amenities (just outside our block.)Altogether it is a very pleasant area in which to live and there's lots to do.The only disadvantage is, it is not near the sea.
